fields.value: On Party Platforms, Mandates, and Government Spending

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study is a reanalysis of Ian Budge and Richard   Hofferbert's 1990 APSR article. The authors successfully replicate the   original analysis, critique the interpretation of the causal effects,   estimate a model that loosens a key assumption, and find that party   platforms have small or nonexistent effects on government spending. The   replication dataset includes Budge and Hofferbert's data that measure   the relative frequency of many different issue areas mentioned in each   party platform, as well as the spending figures in corresponding areas   of the federal budget. Also included are programs to replicate Table 1  and Figure 1 in the article.
